SENT.plain: Behçet's disease is characterized by the triad of aphteous stomatitis, genital ulcerations and uveitis
This syndrome is thought to be a systemic disease with various unspecific manifestations, which may arise in other organs as well in a considerable number of cases
More than 50% of all patients do have gastrointestinal symptoms; erosive and ulcerative lesions are found primarily in the jejunum and colon
Case reports are given of 3 patients with Behçet's disease and gastrointestinal involvement; one of these patients died
All patients did have unspecific changes of esophageal motility
